title: How to Make a Vegetarian Philly Cheesesteak

steps.headline: Heat the oil.
steps.description: Put two teaspoons of olive oil in a medium sized frying pan. Place the pan on the stove burner. Turn on the burner to medium-high heat.

steps.headline: Cook the onions.
steps.description: Add the onions to the hot oil in the frying pan. Fry the onions over medium-high heat until they are soft and begin to brown. This should take about 2-3 minutes.

steps.headline: Add the remaining vegetables and spices.
steps.description: Once the onions are soft and have begun to brown, add the rest of the veggies. Place the bell pepper, Portobello mushrooms, oregano, and black pepper in the frying pan with the onions. Cook until soft. This will take about 7 minutes.

steps.headline: Reduce the heat.
steps.description: After you have cooked the onions, mushrooms, bell pepper and spices together for about 7 minutes, you will need to reduce the heat. Turn the burner down to low heat.

steps.headline: Coat the vegetables with flour.
steps.description: Use your hands to take a pinch of the tablespoon of flour. Lightly sprinkle the vegetables with flour. Repeat until you have sprinkled the entire tablespoon of flour over the vegetables. Stir to coat the vegetables.

steps.headline: Add the broth and soy sauce.
steps.description: Once you have coated the vegetables with flour, add the broth and soy sauce to the skillet. Stir to combine. Bring the mixture to a simmer and then remove from heat immediately. This should take 2-3 minutes or less.

steps.headline: Top with cheese.
steps.description: After removing the frying pan from the stove, top the vegetable mixture with the cheese slices. Lay the slices of cheese directly on top of the vegetables and let stand until melted. This should take about 1-2 minutes.

steps.headline: Serve on toasted buns.
steps.description: Once the cheese is melted, you can serve the vegetables on toasted whole wheat buns. Use a spatula to scoop the mixture from the bottom of the pan, taking caution not to disrupt the cheese. Serve with a side of grilled vegetables or a salad for a well-rounded meal.

steps.headline: Preheat the oven.
steps.description: Before you begin making the filling for your seitan Philly cheesesteak, you will need to preheat the oven. Turn the oven on to 425 degrees Fahrenheit or 220 degrees Celsius.

steps.headline: Heat the oil.
steps.description: Put one tablespoon of the oil in a large skillet. Place the skillet on the stovetop. Turn the burner on to medium heat.

steps.headline: Add the onion and peppers.
steps.description: Put the onions, red pepper, and green pepper in the skillet Cook until the onion turns translucent. This should take about 5-10 minutes.

steps.headline: Add the mushrooms.
steps.description: Once the onions become translucent, add the mushrooms. Cook the mushrooms with the onions and peppers until all the vegetables are tender. This will take about 5-10 minutes. Transfer all the vegetables to a large bowl and set aside.

steps.headline: Add the remaining olive oil to the skillet.
steps.description: Once you have removed the vegetables from the skillet, you will need to add the remaining olive oil. Put one tablespoon of olive oil in the skillet and return to the burner.

steps.headline: Brown the seitan.
steps.description: Once you have added the remaining olive oil to the skillet, add the seitan. Brown the seitan over medium until it is browned on all sides. Make sure you turn the seitan frequently while browning. This process should take about 5-10 minutes.

steps.headline: Return the vegetables to the skillet.
steps.description: Once the seitan is browned, return the vegetables to the skillet. Stir to combine the vegetables with the seitan. Turn the stove off the season the mixture with salt and pepper to taste.

steps.headline: Fill the hoagie rolls.
steps.description: Place the hoagie rolls open-faced on a large baking sheet. Fill each of the rolls with ¼ of the mixture. Top each roll with 1 slice of provolone cheese.

steps.headline: Bake the sandwiches.
steps.description: Once you have filled the hoagie rolls with the seitan mixture and topped each roll with cheese, place the baking sheet in the oven. Heat the sandwiches until the cheese is melted. This should take about 5 minutes.

steps.headline: Serve the sandwiches.
steps.description: After the sandwiches have baked for about 5 minutes, remove the baking sheet from the oven. Turn the oven off immediately. Use a spatula to lift each sandwich from the baking sheet. Place the sandwiches on individual plates and enjoy!

steps.headline: Drain, rinse, and press the tofu.
steps.description: Remove the tofu from the package and drain the liquid. Cut the tofu into ¼ inch or .65 centimeter thick slices. Line a plate with 4 paper towels. Place the tofu on the paper towels and then place an additional 4 paper towels on top of the tofu. Use your hands to press the tofu. You can repeat the pressing with new paper towels until very little water comes out of the tofu when you press it. You can also use clean dish towels instead of paper towels.

steps.headline: Slice the tofu into strips.
steps.description: Once you have pressed the tofu, you will need to cut it into strips. Using a paring knife, cut the individual squares of tofu into thin strips. The strips should be about into ¼ inch or .65 centimeter thick.

steps.headline: Heat the oil.
steps.description: Put one teaspoon of olive oil in a medium sized frying pan. Place the pan on the stove burner. Turn the heat on the burner to medium.

steps.headline: Fry the shallots.
steps.description: Add two diced shallots to the hot oil in the frying pan. Fry the shallots over medium heat until they begin to brown. This should take about 3-4 minutes.

steps.headline: Add the red bell pepper.
steps.description: Place the strips of bell pepper into the frying pan with the shallots. Cook the pepper along with the shallots for an additional 4 minutes.

steps.headline: Incorporate the maple syrup.
steps.description: After you have cooked the shallots and pepper together for 4 minutes, add one tablespoon of maple syrup to the frying pan. Continue cooking the shallots and pepper with the maple syrup for 1 minute.

steps.headline: Add the tofu, nutritional yeast, and soy sauce.
steps.description: After you have cooked with maple syrup with the shallots and pepper for 1 minute, add the remaining ingredients. Place the strips of tofu, 1 tablespoon of nutritional yeast, and 1 tablespoon of soy sauce in the skillet. Cook all the ingredients for an additional 3-4 minutes.

steps.headline: Remove the pan and add the vegan cheese.
steps.description: Take the frying pan off the heat. Add ½ cup of vegan “cheese” shreds over the top of the mixture. Allow to melt for about 1 minute. Then stir the mixture 2-3 times to incorporate the shreds.

steps.headline: Serve on a toasted bun.
steps.description: Now it’s time to enjoy your vegan Philly cheesesteak. Place the tofu mixture on a toasted bun of your choice. A ciabatta roll or traditional hoagie bun are great choices. Serve with a side salad for a quick, easy, and tasty lunch or dinner.

text: Making a Portobello Philly Cheesesteak Heat the oil. Put two teaspoons of olive oil in a medium sized frying pan. Place the pan on the stove burner. Turn on the burner to medium-high heat. Cook the onions. Add the onions to the hot oil in the frying pan. Fry the onions over medium-high heat until they are soft and begin to brown. This should take about 2-3 minutes. Add the remaining vegetables and spices. Once the onions are soft and have begun to brown, add the rest of the veggies. Place the bell pepper, Portobello mushrooms, oregano, and black pepper in the frying pan with the onions. Cook until soft. This will take about 7 minutes. Reduce the heat. After you have cooked the onions, mushrooms, bell pepper and spices together for about 7 minutes, you will need to reduce the heat. Turn the burner down to low heat. Coat the vegetables with flour. Use your hands to take a pinch of the tablespoon of flour. Lightly sprinkle the vegetables with flour. Repeat until you have sprinkled the entire tablespoon of flour over the vegetables. Stir to coat the vegetables. Add the broth and soy sauce. Once you have coated the vegetables with flour, add the broth and soy sauce to the skillet. Stir to combine. Bring the mixture to a simmer and then remove from heat immediately. This should take 2-3 minutes or less. Top with cheese. After removing the frying pan from the stove, top the vegetable mixture with the cheese slices. Lay the slices of cheese directly on top of the vegetables and let stand until melted. This should take about 1-2 minutes. Serve on toasted buns. Once the cheese is melted, you can serve the vegetables on toasted whole wheat buns. Use a spatula to scoop the mixture from the bottom of the pan, taking caution not to disrupt the cheese. Serve with a side of grilled vegetables or a salad for a well-rounded meal. Making a Seitan Philly Cheesesteak Preheat the oven. Before you begin making the filling for your seitan Philly cheesesteak, you will need to preheat the oven. Turn the oven on to 425 degrees Fahrenheit or 220 degrees Celsius. Heat the oil. Put one tablespoon of the oil in a large skillet. Place the skillet on the stovetop. Turn the burner on to medium heat. Add the onion and peppers. Put the onions, red pepper, and green pepper in the skillet Cook until the onion turns translucent. This should take about 5-10 minutes. Add the mushrooms. Once the onions become translucent, add the mushrooms. Cook the mushrooms with the onions and peppers until all the vegetables are tender. This will take about 5-10 minutes. Transfer all the vegetables to a large bowl and set aside. Add the remaining olive oil to the skillet. Once you have removed the vegetables from the skillet, you will need to add the remaining olive oil. Put one tablespoon of olive oil in the skillet and return to the burner. Brown the seitan. Once you have added the remaining olive oil to the skillet, add the seitan. Brown the seitan over medium until it is browned on all sides. Make sure you turn the seitan frequently while browning. This process should take about 5-10 minutes. Return the vegetables to the skillet. Once the seitan is browned, return the vegetables to the skillet. Stir to combine the vegetables with the seitan. Turn the stove off the season the mixture with salt and pepper to taste. Fill the hoagie rolls. Place the hoagie rolls open-faced on a large baking sheet. Fill each of the rolls with ¼ of the mixture. Top each roll with 1 slice of provolone cheese. Bake the sandwiches. Once you have filled the hoagie rolls with the seitan mixture and topped each roll with cheese, place the baking sheet in the oven. Heat the sandwiches until the cheese is melted. This should take about 5 minutes. Serve the sandwiches. After the sandwiches have baked for about 5 minutes, remove the baking sheet from the oven. Turn the oven off immediately. Use a spatula to lift each sandwich from the baking sheet. Place the sandwiches on individual plates and enjoy! Making a Vegan Philly Cheesesteak Drain, rinse, and press the tofu. Remove the tofu from the package and drain the liquid. Cut the tofu into ¼ inch or .65 centimeter thick slices. Line a plate with 4 paper towels. Place the tofu on the paper towels and then place an additional 4 paper towels on top of the tofu. Use your hands to press the tofu. You can repeat the pressing with new paper towels until very little water comes out of the tofu when you press it. You can also use clean dish towels instead of paper towels. Slice the tofu into strips. Once you have pressed the tofu, you will need to cut it into strips. Using a paring knife, cut the individual squares of tofu into thin strips. The strips should be about into ¼ inch or .65 centimeter thick. Heat the oil. Put one teaspoon of olive oil in a medium sized frying pan. Place the pan on the stove burner. Turn the heat on the burner to medium. Fry the shallots. Add two diced shallots to the hot oil in the frying pan. Fry the shallots over medium heat until they begin to brown. This should take about 3-4 minutes. Add the red bell pepper. Place the strips of bell pepper into the frying pan with the shallots. Cook the pepper along with the shallots for an additional 4 minutes. Incorporate the maple syrup. After you have cooked the shallots and pepper together for 4 minutes, add one tablespoon of maple syrup to the frying pan. Continue cooking the shallots and pepper with the maple syrup for 1 minute. Add the tofu, nutritional yeast, and soy sauce. After you have cooked with maple syrup with the shallots and pepper for 1 minute, add the remaining ingredients. Place the strips of tofu, 1 tablespoon of nutritional yeast, and 1 tablespoon of soy sauce in the skillet. Cook all the ingredients for an additional 3-4 minutes. Remove the pan and add the vegan cheese. Take the frying pan off the heat. Add ½ cup of vegan “cheese” shreds over the top of the mixture. Allow to melt for about 1 minute. Then stir the mixture 2-3 times to incorporate the shreds. Serve on a toasted bun. Now it’s time to enjoy your vegan Philly cheesesteak. Place the tofu mixture on a toasted bun of your choice. A ciabatta roll or traditional hoagie bun are great choices. Serve with a side salad for a quick, easy, and tasty lunch or dinner.
